11. FAO farm classification sector
Sector 1
Industrial integrated system with high biosecurity levels and chickens/products marketed commercially, e.g. farms that are part of an integrated broiler production enterprise with clearly defined and implemented standard operating procedures for biosecurity
Sector 2
Commercial chicken production system with moderate to high biosecurity systems and chicken/products usually marketed commercially, e.g. farms with chickens kept indoors continuously, strictly preventing contact with other chickens or wildlife
Sector 3
Commercial chicken production system with low to minimal biosecurity and chicken/products sold in live chicken markets e.g. a caged layer farm with chickens in open sheds, a farm with chickens spending time outside the shed, a farm producing both chickens and waterfowl.
Select Sectors
Sector 1
Sector 2
Sector 3

31. What happens with you?
Usually, if you get a prescription of using antibiotics in your chicken for 5 days. After administering 3 doses you start seeing your chicken almost recovered/symptoms and signs of the disease discontinued.
Stops treatment
Saves the remaining antibiotics for the next time my chicken get sick
Discards the remaining, left over medication
Complete the full course of treatment
Other
Other

Please indicate to what extent you agree or disagree with the following statements
44. Antibiotic resistance in chickens occurs when a body becomes resistant to antibiotics and they no longer work as well.
(5)Strongly agree; (4) Agree; (3) No opinion; (2) Disagree; (1) Strongly disagree
45. Many infections in chickens are becoming increasingly resistant to treatment by antibiotics.
(5)Strongly agree; (4) Agree; (3) No opinion; (2) Disagree; (1) Strongly disagree
46. If bacteria are resistant to antibiotics, it can be very difficult or impossible to treat the infection they cause.
(5)Strongly agree; (4) Agree; (3) No opinion; (2) Disagree; (1) Strongly disagree
47. Antibiotic resistance in chicken is an issue that could affect human health.
(5)Strongly agree; (4) Agree; (3) No opinion; (2) Disagree; (1) Strongly disagree
48. Antibiotic resistance is an issue in other countries but not in Tanzania.
(5)Strongly agree; (4) Agree; (3) No opinion; (2) Disagree; (1) Strongly disagree
49. Antibiotics should be added to animal feed at any time to prevent chickens from becoming sick.
(5)Strongly agree; (4) Agree; (3) No opinion; (2) Disagree; (1) Strongly disagree
Please indicate to what extent you agree or disagree with the following statements
50. It is necessary to give antibiotics to chickens reared in crowded conditions to prevent the spread of disease.
(5)Strongly agree; (4) Agree; (3) No opinion; (2) Disagree; (1) Strongly disagree
51. Once a chicken shows any kind of symptoms, antibiotics should be given to the chickens to prevent the entire flock from becoming infected.
(5)Strongly agree; (4) Agree; (3) No opinion; (2) Disagree; (1) Strongly disagree
52. When antibiotics are about to expire, it is better to give medication to the chicken to prevent wastage
(5)Strongly agree; (4) Agree; (3) No opinion; (2) Disagree; (1) Strongly disagree
53. Antibiotics can be passed to humans from consumption of chicken meat.
(5)Strongly agree; (4) Agree; (3) No opinion; (2) Disagree; (1) Strongly disagree
54. Antibiotics can be passed to humans from consumption of eggs from chickens.
(5)Strongly agree; (4) Agree; (3) No opinion; (2) Disagree; (1) Strongly disagree
